department: Foreign Affairs, Trade And Development (Department Of)
short_summary: Temporary Help Service: Computer Application Support (Intermediate Level)
description: The Access Management Unit (AMU) provides the department, and its partners, with access to its key IM/IT systems. This includes network system access, email accounts, email distribution lists, security groups for shared network drives, PKI encryption, remote access via SECURID tokens, etc. to its clients in 170 locations throughout the world. Using ITSM (IT Service Management) software tools (BMC Remedy), the AMU manages access to DFATD’s classified and designated networks. This includes creating, deleting, moving, updating client’s user accounts, email accounts, and security groups in a Microsoft Windows environment. Access Management Administrators use customized web based tools, and execute visual basic scripts, to access the Windows Active Directory environment. The Administrators also use vendor provided applications such as MEK and RSA to provide clients with remote access to DFATD’s voice and data networks. Also, administration of DFTAD’s access to entrust encryption software and access to employees’ web based compensation portal.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

### Reference:
PW-22-01017442

### Title:
Temporary Help Services (THS) - Up to four (4) Computer Application Support - Intermediate

### Description:
Temporary Help Services (THS) is a Request for Proposal (RFP) for up to four (4) Conference Application Support resources with Intermediate expertise. This is in accordance with the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and involves working with the Access Management Unit (AMU) within the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD).

### Vendor Requirements:
- Esteemed service providers having Temporary Help Services (THS) agreements
- Qualified Vendors experienced in working in the National Capital Region (NCR)
- Proposed solutions must iteratively meet requirements and customer needs for minimal business disruptions

### Communication Channels:
To submit an expectional service proposal, kindly email the Contracting Authority, [atleastyou@companyname](mailto:sm11aesuouslyazon+z Advisor Facts@gmail.com), ahead of the ten-day window preceding the 2022-12-23 14:00h meeting for an approval to begin expert collaboration.
